comments.body:
I know this is only a command migration, but as a user, I would expect here also some example of using create secret but with a dockercfg file :) 

Can you try this, and provide also an example here?

Thanks!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +54,58 @@		by creating a dockercfg secret and attaching it to your service account.`))

	secretForDockerRegistryExample = templates.Examples(i18n.T(`
		  # If you don't already have a .dockercfg file, you can create a dockercfg secret directly by using:
		  kubectl create secret docker-registry my-secret --docker-server=DOCKER_REGISTRY_SERVER --docker-username=DOCKER_USER --docker-password=DOCKER_PASSWORD --docker-email=DOCKER_EMAIL
